com.google.appinventor.components.runtime

Class AccelerometerSensor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.AndroidNonvisibleComponent
      • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.AccelerometerSensor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Component, Deleteable, OnResumeListener, OnStopListener, SensorComponent

    public class AccelerometerSensor
extends AndroidNonvisibleComponent
implements OnStopListener, OnResumeListener, SensorComponent, Deleteable
    Physical world component that can detect shaking and measure acceleration in three dimensions. It is implemented using android.hardware.SensorListener (http://developer.android.com/reference/android/hardware/SensorListener.html).

    From the Android documentation: "Sensor values are acceleration in the X, Y and Z axis, where the X axis has positive direction toward the right side of the device, the Y axis has positive direction toward the top of the device and the Z axis has positive direction toward the front of the device. The direction of the force of gravity is indicated by acceleration values in the X, Y and Z axes. The typical case where the device is flat relative to the surface of the Earth appears as -STANDARD_GRAVITY in the Z axis and X and Y values close to zero. Acceleration values are given in SI units (m/s^2)."

    • Method Detail

      • MinimumInterval

        public int MinimumInterval()
        Returns the minimum interval required between calls to Shaking(), in milliseconds. Once the phone starts being shaken, all further Shaking() calls will be ignored until the interval has elapsed.
        Returns:
        minimum interval in ms

      • MinimumInterval

        public void MinimumInterval(int interval)
        Specifies the minimum interval required between calls to Shaking(), in milliseconds. Once the phone starts being shaken, all further Shaking() calls will be ignored until the interval has elapsed.
        Parameters:
        interval - minimum interval in ms

      • Sensitivity

        public int Sensitivity()
        Returns a number that encodes how sensitive the AccelerometerSensor is. The choices are: 1 = weak, 2 = moderate, 3 = strong.
        Returns:
        one of Component.ACCELEROMETER_SENSITIVITY_WEAK, Component.ACCELEROMETER_SENSITIVITY_MODERATE or Component.ACCELEROMETER_SENSITIVITY_STRONG

      • Sensitivity

        public void Sensitivity(int sensitivity)
        Specifies the sensitivity of the accelerometer and checks that the argument is a legal value.
        Parameters:
        sensitivity - one of Component.ACCELEROMETER_SENSITIVITY_WEAK, Component.ACCELEROMETER_SENSITIVITY_MODERATE or Component.ACCELEROMETER_SENSITIVITY_STRONG

                                float yAccel,
                                float zAccel)
        Indicates the acceleration changed in the X, Y, and/or Z dimensions.

      • Shaking

        public void Shaking()
        Indicates the device started being shaken or continues to be shaken.

      • Available

        public boolean Available()
        Available property getter method (read-only property).
        Returns:
        true indicates that an accelerometer sensor is available, false that it isn't

      • Enabled

        public boolean Enabled()
        If true, the sensor will generate events. Otherwise, no events are generated even if the device is accelerated or shaken.
        Returns:
        true indicates that the sensor generates events, false that it doesn't

      • startListening

        private void startListening()

      • stopListening

        private void stopListening()

      • Enabled

        public void Enabled(boolean enabled)
        Specifies whether the sensor should generate events. If true, the sensor will generate events. Otherwise, no events are generated even if the device is accelerated or shaken.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true enables sensor event generation, false disables it

      • XAccel

        public float XAccel()
        Returns the acceleration in the X-dimension in SI units (m/s^2). The sensor must be enabled to return meaningful values.
        Returns:
        X acceleration

      • YAccel

        public float YAccel()
        Returns the acceleration in the Y-dimension in SI units (m/s^2). The sensor must be enabled to return meaningful values.
        Returns:
        Y acceleration

      • ZAccel

        public float ZAccel()
        Returns the acceleration in the Z-dimension in SI units (m/s^2). The sensor must be enabled to return meaningful values.
        Returns:
        Z acceleration
